about: Mechatronics Engineering is an interdisciplinary field that combines mechanical, electrical, electronics, and computer engineering to design and develop intelligent systems and automation solutions. It focuses on creating smart machines, robotics, and advanced control systems that enhance efficiency and precision in various industries. Mechatronics engineers work on automation, robotics, embedded systems, sensors, and artificial intelligence to develop cutting-edge technologies used in manufacturing, healthcare, automotive, and aerospace sectors. With the increasing integration of IoT and AI-driven automation, Mechatronics Engineering plays a crucial role in modern industry, driving innovation in smart systems, autonomous machines, and intelligent manufacturing processes.
vision: To be a centre of excellence for development and dissemination of knowledge in Mechatronics Engineering for the Nation and beyond.
mission: Disseminate knowledge through effective teaching-learning process to develop technically competent and ethically strong Mechatronics professionals.
Foster continuous interdisciplinary learning and research to meet real-world challenges by nurturing innovation through state-of-the-art facilities.
Promote societal based consultancy and training services in collaboration with Industries and R&D organizations.
objective: To equip students with the necessary technical and managerial skills.
peo: Utilize the fundamental knowledge of basic sciences and engineering to succeed in their profession.
Design and develop Mechatronics products and processes for real world applications.
Exhibit professional and managerial capabilities with ethical conduct and have an aptitude for continuous learning.
po: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.
Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.
Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.
pso: Design and develop Mechatronic systems by synergistic combination of mechanical engineering, electronic controls and systems.
Adapt multidisciplinary approach to solve real world industrial problems.

detail: Centre of Excellence in Robotics and Automation (COE-R&A) is a cutting-edge state of art platform to learn, build, explore and realize Robot technologies.
COE-R&A holds Fanuc ER-4iA Robot, Fanuc CNC Simulator, ABB IRB 1410 Robot, Humanoid Robot: NAO 6th Gen, Dobot Magician Kit with Accessories, QBot 2e and various software tools to equip the users.
It enables the user to experience the Robotic and Automation world to meet the growing demands for trained engineers in the industrial automation.
It also offers multifold benefits for promoting research, participation in national and international competitions, availing grants and tailor-made as expected by users.
- Lab VIEW Robotics SbRIO Starter Kit
- Upgrade, NI Academic site License, Department Fall 2010
Computer Aided Manufacturing (CAM) centre affords space for students to work on diverse aspects of design and manufacturing related activities.
Students have access to advanced tools in Design, Analysis, Simulation and Manufacturing platforms to explore and gain knowledge.
This centre also focuses on providing hands-on experience in the additive manufacturing technique (Fused Deposition Modelling) to realize product development.
- Mastercam X5 and X9 (Add on Multi-Axis)

labs.topic: THOMAS ALVA EDISON INDUSTRIAL AUTOMATION CONTROLLER LABORATORY
detail: This laboratory focuses on providing hands-on experience on Relay logic controllers, microcontroller programming, PLC programming, HMI, and SCADA.
- Workstation with discrete and analog I/O’s for temperature, flow, and speed control
- Siemens PLC’s, HMIs, and Servo Drive Interface module
- Beckhoff soft PLC’s with interfacing I/O’s modules
- SIEMENS Softwares: TIA PORTAL V15, TIA PORTAL V16
CNC machines play an important role in the manufacturing industry, providing efficiency, accuracy, and consistency.
- Ace - Jobber XL Production version CNC Turning Center
- HMT - VMC 200 CNC Trainmaster Machine Center
- System with Mastercam software - 2 nos for interfacing with CNC machines

labs.topic: ROBERT E NEWNHAM SENSORS AND INTERNET OF THINGS LABORATORY
detail: This lab helps students develop knowledge about sensor technology and IoT applications.
- Speed Control & Closed Loop Control of DC Motor
- TREK 668 Embedded IoT computer (Sponsored by Advantech Co Ltd, India)
The Fluid Power Lab is equipped with various pneumatic and hydraulic trainer kits.
- Magnetic Flow symbols Trainer kit – JANATICS
- Electro Pneumatic Trainer Kit with Profile Plate – FESTO & JANATICS
- Basic Hydraulic Trainer kit with linear and rotary actuators - MANSCO

Jeff Kodosky Virtual Instrumentation Laboratory accommodates KEC - NI LabVIEW Academy School. The laboratory focuses on educating the students with in-depth knowledge about virtual instrumentation and its real time applications. LabVIEW provides a graphical programming approach that helps to visualize every aspect of our application, including hardware configuration, measurement data, and debugging.
The Research Laboratory is equipped with various facilities for the benefit of students and research scholars of the department.
- Pin on Disc – Friction and Wear test rig
- DataLOG (Miniature Wireless Bluetooth) surface EMG system
- Remote monitoring & control of pressure & flow in pipeline system
- Electro-hydraulic servo system with fuzzy logic controller for Hydraulic Presses
- Emotiv EPOCX IN CHANNEL Mobile brain wear

The Control Engineering Laboratory facilitates students in enhancing their learning of control systems in time and frequency domain. It imparts knowledge on developing mathematical models of physical systems and analyzing their behavior.
- Servo Hydraulic System with Feedback Amplifier

labs.topic: Electron Devices and Digital Circuits Laboratory
detail: This laboratory is intended for teaching and project development in electric circuits, electronic devices, and digital electronics.
The Project Laboratory is a place for creative learning and innovation. Here, students get valuable hands-on experience with a state-of-the-art environment in the field of Mechatronics Engineering.
